docs.text: wolfgang petersen's latest , the perfect storm , is like a pineapple .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it only tastes good after arduous peeling and digging - if you try to eat the fruit , spikes and all , it's going to hurt ? quite a bit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ok , maybe that was a confusing analogy , so here's my main complaint about the latest man battles nature flick : there isn't really much of a story to tell .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: basically , a massachusetts fishing crew goes out to sea on a small boat , called the andrea gail , and gets stuck in the middle of " the storm of the century . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how much time does it take for petersen to tell this story ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not nearly enough .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so he spends the majority of the film developing pointless side stories which all eventually become superfluous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: audiences want to see the storm , they want to see a fight for survival but what they get is a lot of cliched , maudlin drivel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the last quarter of the perfect storm is utterly perfect in every aspect , but just try lasting the first three-quarters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i have yet to read sebastian junger's the perfect storm , but from what i have heard it is an unforgettable tale .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: based on a true story , the book must have found some other way to introduce the characters because in the movie version , the approach is weak .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: using a wonderfully patriotic score by james horner , petersen almost hides the in-your-face banality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: right away the central characters are introduced : the gritty , determined captain ( george clooney ) , the ingenue ( mark wahlberg ) torn between his job and his girlfriend ( diane lane ) , the loving father ( john c . reilly ) , the comic relief who's always trying to get laid ( john hawkes ) , the new guy ( william fichtner ) who immediately antagonizes a crewmate and the quiet , french guy ( allen payne ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so many problems strike the opening segment of the film that the remaining portions directly suffer .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not the all-star cast's fault , just the characters designed for their portrayal .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: allen payne's character never speaks in the entire movie , not because he is mute , but because he's never given any lines !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: are we supposed to root for a guy whose face and voice we are never given a chance to interact with ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fichtner's character is terribly underdeveloped - we don't know what he's doing there , where he's from , or who he's supposed to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the remaining four fishermen are all cardboard stereotypes ( hawkes says to a female stranger in one scene " you know what would look good on you ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: me ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ooooh real creative ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as the script advances and the andrea gail floats farther out into the waters , the crew continues to not feel human .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only when the storm takes center stage does the movie jump out of its sleepwalk .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the computer-generated images of gigantic waves crashing against a helpless boat are thunderously real .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i can only imagine if this was an imax film , this city kid would surely never go in the water again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is loud , jolting entertainment - adjectives that completely negate the rest of the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the perfect storm was unfortunately a disappointment .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the maelstrom lived up to its potential but everything else failed to do so .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess i'll stick to that other survival spectacle ? you know the one on cbs ?
docs.label: negative
